alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 06 at 6:27PM EDT until August 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTY... At 626 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Smithfield, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Micro, Selma, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Kenly and Princeton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
